action.action-desc: Mr. Bacon introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of the Air Force to develop a force design for the Air Force and the Space Force, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Air Force Future Force Design Act of 2023.

section.header: Future force design of the Department of the Air Force

subsection.text: Not later than August 31, 2024, the Secretary of the Air Force shall develop a force design for the Air Force and Space Force projected through 2050.
The force design under subsection (a) shall address—

paragraph.text: the concepts, capabilities, and structural elements (including size and form) of the Air Force and Space Force that are necessary to ensure those forces effectively execute their core functions through 2050 in support of the National Defense Strategy and the National Military Strategy;

force structure, including the development of capabilities (including platforms and systems) at the correct level of capacity to address the challenges outlined by the National Defense Strategy and the National Military Strategy;

force composition, including recruitment and development of human capital, effective distribution of forces in the total force, and policies to increase career flexibility across the various components of the force;
organizational design, including development of potential models to increase agility and operational effectiveness across the Air Force and Space Force; and
such other matters as the Secretary of the Air Force determines to be relevant.

subsection.text: Not later than 60 days after completion of the force design required under subsection (a), the Secretary of the Air Force shall—

paragraph.text: submit a summary of the force design to the congressional defense committees; and
provide to the congressional defense committees a briefing on the force design.

subsection.text: In this section, the term congressional defense committees has the meaning given that term in section 101(a)(16) of title 10, United States Code.
